Inquiry devices
  1. Click on to start inquiry remote Bluetooth devices. The devices found are shown in the main window. They are represented by an icon (showing what class of device they are: computer, laptop, pda, audio device) and the name of the device.

Once you have clicked one time on all futures clicks will show devices without inquirying (to decrease search time). To inquiry again remote bluetooth devices you must refresh the list by clicking on .
(Note : All the coupled devices are shown without inquiry)
During an inquiry, you can stop it by clicking on the icon

See Also
Device pairing

Device pairing


To be paired with another distant device

See Also
Inquiry devices

To be paired with another distant device
  1. Right click on the selected device and click on pair
See Also

A distant device try to pair with the current device (with no Auto Pin Code)
  1. When a device try to pair with the current device, a new window appear to enter the pin code selected by the distant device
See Also
To be paired with another distant device
A distant device try to pair with the current device (With auto Pin Code)

A distant device try to pair with the current device (With auto Pin Code)
  1. When a device try to pair with the current device,the user is not invited to type a pin code. It is automatically typed for him
See Also
To be paired with another distant device
A distant device try to pair with the current device (with no Auto Pin Code)

Properties and configuration

Local services
Local device properties and configuration

About box


Local services
  1. Click on , to administrate local services. Local services are shown in the list view with a specific icon and an explicit name.
  2. Activate or deactivate a local service by double-clicking it or by right clicking it and selecting the Start or stop item from the contextual menu.
  3. You can also configure the service by selecting the Properties Item when you right click him.
See Also
Local device properties and configuration
Remote device properties
About box

Local device properties and configuration
  1. Click on , to see:
    - application option (start minimized, Auto assigned COM port number for client SPP and server)
    - the local device properties (MAC address, name and device type)
    - security options of the bluetooth manager
See Also

About box
  1. Click on the icon if you want some general information about the bluetooth manager

Local services
Local device properties and configuration
Remote device properties

Remote device properties

You can have general information on a distant device (like the General tab of the Local device properties) by selecting “properties” in the contextual menu of the distant device.

  1. In the devices view, right click on the device
  2. select “properties” in the contextual menu of the distant device.
See Also
Local services
Local device properties and configuration
About box

Remote services

Services Inquiry
File Transfer
Object Push
Serial Port
Dial-Up Networking


Services Inquiry

To inquiry the services available on a distant device:

  1. Double click on the device.

After that, the bluetooth manager inquiries (it indicates this in the status bar) for all the services (among SPP/FTP/OPP/DUN) of the distant device. You can stop the inquiry with the icon. You can also refresh the list of services by clicking on the icon.

See Also
File Transfer
Object Push
Serial Port
Dial-Up Networking

File Transfer

To use File Transfer service:

  1. Double click on the icon or choose connect on the contextual menu (right click)

The bluetooth Manager tries to connect to the distant service. If the connection is successful, the root directory shared by the distant will be shown in the list view. You can browse the device by double clicking on the remote folder and go to the parent directory with .
To get a file :

  1. Double-click on it or choose “Get File” from its contextual menu

You can upload a file to the distant device by right-clicking on a whitespace of the listview and select "Add file". You can also delete a file by selecting delete on his contextual menu.

See Also
Services Inquiry
Object Push
Serial Port
Dial-Up Networking

Object Push

To use Object Push service:

  1. Double-click on icon or select “Push file” on the contextual menu.
  2. Choose the file to transfer.
See Also
Services Inquiry
File Transfer
Serial Port
Dial-Up Networking

Serial Port

To use this serial service:

  1. Double-click on the icon or choose “Connect” from the contextual menu.

( If the Auto Client COM Port is not checked,the application shows a dialog box with all the available COM to select.)

See Also
Services Inquiry
File Transfer
Object Push
Dial-Up Networking

Dial-Up Networking

To use the Dial-up Networking service:

  1. Double click on the icon or choose "Connect" in the contextual menu. The first avalaible COM port in the system is assigned to the DUN profil on the selected device.
See Also
Services Inquiry
File Transfer
Object Push
Serial Port

Remote disconnection management

When a connection, previously established, is shut down by the distant host (manual disconnection or connection loss due to distant device shutting down or due to a weak signal), the user is notified of the disconnection and the Manager attempts to reconnect during a time t (by default, 1min30). The notification is made by a pop-up window and by changing the icon associated to the disconnected service


Connection shortcuts management

Shortcuts associated to defined services on defined devices make establishing connections with distant devices easier.

Create a shortcut :

  1. Right click on the remote service shortcut.
  2. Select "Create shortcut" item in the contextual menu of a connected service.

If the shortcut is successfully created, a notification is also displayed.

To Display the connection shortcuts list:

  1. Click on icon to display the shorcuts list.

To establish a connection from the shortcut:

  1. Double-click on the shortcut icon or select "Connect" in the contextual menu.

Once the connection is established (even if the connection is not successfully established), the display is switched to the services list associated to device linked to the shortcut. The connection status of the service (connected or not) is displayed not only on the service icon but also on the associated shortcut icon. However, disconnection can only be performed from the service contextual menu

Delete a shortcut :

  1. Right click on the remote service shortcut.
  2. Select "Delete" item in the contextual menu. The user must confirm the deletion.

Stop the Bluetooth Manager
  1. Select Start menu
  2. Select Settings
  3. Select System tab
  4. Click on Memory manager
  5. Select Current Programs tab
  6. Select ADENEO BthManager
  7. Click on Stop
